story:
Once upon a time, in a small village in the Philippines, there lived a kind and curious boy named Juan. Juan loved to explore the world around him and spent his days playing in the fields and forests near his home.

One day, while Juan was wandering through the forest, he came across a beautiful bird with vibrant feathers of every color. The bird was perched on a branch, singing a sweet and melodic song.

Juan was captivated by the bird's beauty and listened to its song for what felt like hours. But as the sun began to set, the bird flew away, leaving Juan alone in the forest.

Determined to find the bird again, Juan spent the next few days searching high and low for any sign of it. He climbed trees, crawled through bushes, and even waded through rivers, but the bird was nowhere to be found.

Just as Juan was about to give up hope, he heard a faint rustling in the bushes. He slowly approached and to his surprise, there was the bird, singing its beautiful song once again.

But this time, the bird seemed to be in distress. It was trapped in a snare, unable to free itself.

Without hesitation, Juan rushed to the bird's aid. He carefully untangled the snare and set the bird free.

The bird, grateful for Juan's help, fluttered its wings and took to the sky. But before it flew away, it turned to Juan and spoke in a soft, gentle voice.

"Thank you, kind boy, for saving me. As a token of my gratitude, I will grant you one wish. Choose wisely."

Juan was stunned. He had never heard of a bird that could speak, let alone grant wishes. He thought long and hard about what he wanted most in the world.

Finally, he spoke. "I wish for the wisdom to know how to help those in need, just as I helped you today."

The bird nodded, and then vanished into thin air, leaving Juan alone in the forest.

But from that day on, Juan found that he had a newfound sense of kindness and compassion. He used his wisdom to help those in need, always remembering the beautiful bird that had changed his life forever.

And as he grew older, he passed down his wisdom to his own children and grandchildren, who in turn shared it with their own families.

And that, my dear son, is the story of how one kind and curious boy became a wise and compassionate man, and how the legacy of his kindness lived on for generations to come.

Now, my dear son, it's time for you to close your eyes and drift off to sleep, filled with dreams of adventure and wonder. And always remember, just like Juan, you too have the power to make a difference in the world and to help those in need. Goodnight, sweet dreams.
